text: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra Yanko Design’s full review of the Galaxy S25 Ultra is on the way, but here’s a sneak peek at what’s to come. Samsung’s latest flagship brings upgraded camera capabilities, faster performance, and next-level Galaxy AI assistance. If you’re considering an upgrade, now is the time—there are only a few hours left to take advantage of Samsung’s exclusive pre-order offers, including savings of up to $900 with an eligible trade-in, instant Samsung Credit, and exclusive colors only available on Samsung.com. 1. Titanium Build That Feels as Good as It Looks The move to a Grade 5 titanium frame gives the S25 Ultra a level of refinement that’s immediately noticeable. Lighter yet incredibly durable, the phone sits comfortably in hand without feeling bulky. Navigating through Dallas with it in my pocket or snapping shots of my daughter at her tennis match, it carries an undeniable sense of quality. Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra vs S24 Ultra The 15% slimmer bezels and rounded corners add to the comfort, while the perfectly clicky buttons and smooth glass-to-frame transition showcase Samsung’s precise engineering. Even after weeks of use without a case, the Titanium Silverblue finish remains flawless. 2. A Display That Outshines Expectations Samsung’s 6.9-inch Dynamic LTPO AMOLED 2X panel isn’t just a spec sheet upgrade—it’s a noticeable leap in everyday usability. Peak brightness hits 2600 nits, making it effortless to check messages or frame a shot under the Texas sun. The Gorilla Armor 2 coating means no more fighting glare, whether I’m working from an outdoor café or reviewing photos at the tennis courts. Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra vs S24 Ultra The adaptive refresh rate, shifting between 1Hz and 120Hz, keeps interactions buttery smooth while optimizing battery life. The nearly borderless design only enhances immersion, making media consumption and photo editing a more seamless experience. 3. A Camera System Built for Real Life The S25 Ultra’s camera setup turns casual moments into stunning captures. A 200MP main sensor upgraded 50MP ultra-wide, and dual telephoto lenses provide an unmatched level of versatility. Whether I’m shooting detailed close-ups of my daughter’s backhand or catching the full atmosphere of a match, every shot comes through with clarity. The ultra-wide’s 120-degree field of view feels natural, avoiding that exaggerated fisheye effect. Macro shots pull out details that often go unnoticed. The dual telephoto system—3x and 5x optical zoom—delivers crisp results, even at 10x magnification. It’s an ideal setup for capturing everything from cityscapes to action shots on the court. 4. Power and Battery Life That Keeps Up Samsung paired the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset with 12GB of RAM on the 256GB version, and it shows. Whether I’m bouncing between Lightroom edits, GPS navigation, and streaming, the S25 Ultra doesn’t stutter. Gaming performance holds up under pressure, running graphically intense titles at max settings without overheating—even in the Texas heat. Battery life holds strong: Over 17 hours of continuous web browsing 8+ hours of screen-on time with heavy use Two full days on a moderate charge 5. Reliability in the Moments That Matter From unlocking instantly with the under-display fingerprint sensor to jotting quick notes with the S Pen, the S25 Ultra feels dialed in. Thermal management keeps it cool under stress, and the software feels optimized, handling multitasking without hesitation. Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra

Yanko Design’s full review of the Galaxy S25 Ultra is on the way, but here’s a sneak peek at what’s to come. Samsung’s latest flagship brings upgraded camera capabilities, faster performance, and next-level Galaxy AI assistance. If you’re considering an upgrade, now is the time—there are only a few hours left to take advantage of Samsung’s exclusive pre-order offers, including savings of up to $900 with an eligible trade-in, instant Samsung Credit, and exclusive colors only available on Samsung.com.

1. Titanium Build That Feels as Good as It Looks

The move to a Grade 5 titanium frame gives the S25 Ultra a level of refinement that’s immediately noticeable. Lighter yet incredibly durable, the phone sits comfortably in hand without feeling bulky. Navigating through Dallas with it in my pocket or snapping shots of my daughter at her tennis match, it carries an undeniable sense of quality.

Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra vs S24 Ultra

The 15% slimmer bezels and rounded corners add to the comfort, while the perfectly clicky buttons and smooth glass-to-frame transition showcase Samsung’s precise engineering. Even after weeks of use without a case, the Titanium Silverblue finish remains flawless.

2. A Display That Outshines Expectations

Samsung’s 6.9-inch Dynamic LTPO AMOLED 2X panel isn’t just a spec sheet upgrade—it’s a noticeable leap in everyday usability. Peak brightness hits 2600 nits, making it effortless to check messages or frame a shot under the Texas sun. The Gorilla Armor 2 coating means no more fighting glare, whether I’m working from an outdoor café or reviewing photos at the tennis courts.

Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra vs S24 Ultra

The adaptive refresh rate, shifting between 1Hz and 120Hz, keeps interactions buttery smooth while optimizing battery life. The nearly borderless design only enhances immersion, making media consumption and photo editing a more seamless experience.

3. A Camera System Built for Real Life

The S25 Ultra’s camera setup turns casual moments into stunning captures. A 200MP main sensor upgraded 50MP ultra-wide, and dual telephoto lenses provide an unmatched level of versatility. Whether I’m shooting detailed close-ups of my daughter’s backhand or catching the full atmosphere of a match, every shot comes through with clarity.

The ultra-wide’s 120-degree field of view feels natural, avoiding that exaggerated fisheye effect. Macro shots pull out details that often go unnoticed. The dual telephoto system—3x and 5x optical zoom—delivers crisp results, even at 10x magnification. It’s an ideal setup for capturing everything from cityscapes to action shots on the court.

4. Power and Battery Life That Keeps Up

Samsung paired the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset with 12GB of RAM on the 256GB version, and it shows. Whether I’m bouncing between Lightroom edits, GPS navigation, and streaming, the S25 Ultra doesn’t stutter. Gaming performance holds up under pressure, running graphically intense titles at max settings without overheating—even in the Texas heat.

Battery life holds strong:

  • Over 17 hours of continuous web browsing
  • 8+ hours of screen-on time with heavy use
  • Two full days on a moderate charge

5. Reliability in the Moments That Matter

From unlocking instantly with the under-display fingerprint sensor to jotting quick notes with the S Pen, the S25 Ultra feels dialed in. Thermal management keeps it cool under stress, and the software feels optimized, handling multitasking without hesitation.
